newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Romanian M2 money supply 6.8 pct up in Nov.
newsitem.headline: Romanian M2 money supply 6.8 pct up in Nov.

text.p: Romania's M2 money supply rose by a monthly rate of 6.8 percent in November after a 7.5 percent increase in October, National Bank (BNR) data showed.
M2, which is Romania's measure of broad money supply, went up by an year-on-year 66.7 percent last November, when it was 51.5 percent up from December 1995.

The M1 narrow money, which include currency outside banks and demand deposits, expanded by 6.9 percent to 10.2 trillion lei at end-November, with cash in circulation soaring to 4.85 trillion lei from 4.52 trillion.
Household savings rose only 3.3 percent to 7.87 trillion lei amid a pre-winter dollar hoarding which triggered a rise in residents' hard currency deposits.
Residents' foreign currency deposits accounted for 23.4 percent of end-November broad money, up from 22.2 percent the previous month.
ROMANIAN MONEY SUPPLY NOV 96 OCT 96 NOV 95
